author: Jason Douglas
title: Fears Brexit Will Spark Violence in Northern Ireland Are Exaggerated, Says DUP Leader
text:
LONDON—Concerns that the U.K.’s departure from the European Union will reignite violence in Northern Ireland are overblown, according to the leader of the Northern Irish political party with an outsize influence on Brexit.
Arlene Foster, leader of the resolutely pro-U.K. Democratic Unionist Party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May’s minority government in London, said that the 1998 Belfast Agreement that ended decades of violence in Northern Ireland will hold after Britain exits the EU in March 2019.
...
